text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a short season.
author: Helen Hayes

text: The only way to recapture the innocence of childhood is to be spontaneous and creative.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Childhood is like being drunk. Everyone remembers what you did, except you.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: In childhood, we press our nose to the pane, looking out. In memories of childhood, we press our nose to the pane, looking in.
author: Robert Brault

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: The most beautiful things in the world are the things that children create.
author: Unknown

text: A happy childhood is one of the best gifts that parents have to give, and one of the best gifts that children have to receive.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a journey, not a race.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a time for building memories, not resumes.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is the world of miracle and wonder; as if creation rose, bathed in the light, out of the darkness, utterly new and fresh and astonishing.
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: Childhood is a short season.
author: Helen Hayes

text: Childhood is a kingdom where nobody dies.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

text: Childhood is a place as well as a time.
author: Louise J. Kaplan

text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: Unknown

text: A happy childhood is a poor preparation for human contacts.
author: Colette

text: Childhood is a time when you scream at the TV and everyone thinks it's cute.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: Unknown

text: The most precious moments in a childhood are the ones that are never shared.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: Unknown

text: Childhood is a short season.
author: Helen Hayes

text: A happy childhood can't be cured. Mine'll hang around my neck like a rainbow, that's all, instead of a noose.
author: Hortense Calisher

text: Childhood is the world of miracle and wonder; as if creation rose, bathed in the light, out of the darkness, utterly new and fresh and astonishing.
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: Childhood is the world of miracle and wonder; as if creation rose, bathed in the light, out of the darkness, utterly new and fresh and astonishing.
author: Eugene Ionesco

author: Eugene Ionesco

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: The best thing about childhood memories is making them.
author: null

text: Childhood is like being drunk, everyone remembers what you did, except you.
author: unknown

text: The most precious jewels you'll ever have around your neck are the arms of your children.
author: unknown

text: Childhood is a short season.
author: Helen Hayes

text: The world is as many times new as there are children in our lives.
author: Robert Brault

text: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

text: The best way to make children good is to make them happy.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Childhood is the kingdom where nobody dies.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

text: I had always thought that once you grew up you could do anything you wanted - stay up all night or eat ice-cream straight out of the container.
author: Bill Bryson

text: I miss my childhood, sometimes. Not the loneliness, the uncertainty, the sadness - but the sense of possibility.
author: Nick Hornby

text: When you finally go back to your old hometown, you find it wasn't the old home you missed but your childhood.
author: Sam Ewing

text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: unknown

text: When childhood dies, its corpses are called adults and they enter society, one of the politer names of hell.
author: Brian Aldiss

text: Childhood is that wonderful time of life when all you need to do to lose weight is take a bath.
author: Richard Reeves

text: Childhood is the one story that stands by itself in every soul.
author: Ivan Doig

text: Childhood is the sleep of reason.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: The things which the child loves remain in the domain of the heart until old age. The most beautiful thing in life is that our souls remain hovering over the places where we once enjoyed ourselves.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: In childhood, we press our nose to the pane, looking out. In memories of childhood, we press our nose to the pane, looking in.
author: Robert Brault

text: I think that the best thing we can do for our children is to allow them to do things for themselves, allow them to be strong, allow them to experience life on their own terms, allow them to take the subway... let them be better people, let them believe more in themselves.
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: Childhood is the world of miracle and wonder; as if creation rose, bathed in the light, out of the darkness, utterly new and fresh and astonishing. The end of childhood is when things cease to astonish us.
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: In every real man a child is hidden that wants to play.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Childhood, after all, is the first precious coin that poverty steals from a child.
author: Anthony Horowitz

text: The childhood shows the man as morning shows the day.
author: John Milton

text: Childhood means simplicity. Look at the world with the child's eye - it is very beautiful.
author: Kailash Satyarthi

text: What a happy and holy fashion it is that those who love one another should rest on the same pillow.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

text: Childhood is the most beautiful of all life's seasons.
author: unknown

text: We could never have loved the earth so well if we had had no childhood in it.
author: George Eliot
